reasoning: THE FINAL TURN - MAXIMUM GOLD EXTRACTION + GARDENS LAND GRAB. The ledger is brutal: P3 leads at 157 VP, I sit at 121, P1 at 117. The gap to P3 is insurmountable (36 VP). The goal is SECURING 2ND PLACE with maximum margin over P1. Strategy: (1) Lord Pemberton's extra action ability gives me 4 actions instead of 3 - a 33% efficiency advantage on the final turn, (2) Fire ALL THREE gold-generating abilities: Harrow jackpot (+6 gold), Brynn transmutation (+4 gold), Tormund maritime dues (+2 gold) = +12 gold total, bringing treasury to 54 gold = 18 VP at 3:1 conversion, (3) GARDENS LAND GRAB - all 7 squares are EMPTY with zero influence from any player. Noble faction from Pemberton (Position 7, active Turn 7) grants Gardens access. Deploy 12 cubes to claim GAR_01 through GAR_05 = 12 VP of FREE territory for minimal investment, (4) Reinforce Academy (11 VP district I control) and fortify BAR_01 (4 VP) against P3's Military faction threat. Harrow's jackpot ability also drops a free cube on MKT_07 Tinker's Corner. Projected final: 121 base + 18 gold conversion + 32 territory = 171 VP. P1 projects around 143 VP. Second place SECURED by 28+ VP margin. The compound interest machine fires its final volley.
recruitment_note: Conspiracy FULL at 8 agents (positions 1-7 plus promoted Calico on Stormwind). No recruitment needed or possible.

actions.ability: 5 Take an extra action this turn.
actions.effect: Unlocks a 4th action this turn. A 33% increase in action economy on the most critical turn of the game. Every extra action is pure profit when deployed against gold-generating abilities. The investment in recruiting Pemberton two cycles ago finally pays its ultimate dividend.

actions.ability: 5 Gain 6 crowns and place one influence in Market.
actions.effect: +6 gold to treasury (42 -> 48). Place 1 free influence cube on MKT_07 Tinker's Corner (1 VP, currently empty - no controller, 0 influence). The jackpot ability delivers maximum gold extraction PLUS a free territorial claim in the Market. Harrow has been the backbone of this economic empire for 5 cycles. His final activation is as profitable as his first.
+4 gold to treasury (48 -> 52). Brynn transmutes intellectual capital into hard currency one final time. Her alchemy has never failed across five cycles of faithful service.

+2 gold to treasury (52 -> 54). Tormund's maritime trade dues round out the gold extraction perfectly. 54 gold divides cleanly by 3 = 18 VP at cycle-end conversion with zero waste. Maximum efficiency.

influence_placements.rationale: FORTRESS the Gardens crown jewel. 4 VP of unclaimed territory for 4 cubes. P3 has Noble access (Baron von Stahl, Position 7) and 32 influence pool - must fortify against potential contest. 4 cubes means any opponent needs 5+ to take it.
Second-highest VP Gardens square. 3 cubes provides solid defense for 3 VP of free territory.
2 VP of empty territory claimed with 2-cube defense. Standard fortress economics for mid-value squares.
Another 2 VP claim. Continued Gardens expansion maximizes territorial VP from virgin territory.
1 VP claim for 1 cube. Minimum viable investment for positive-VP squares. Skip GAR_06 (0 VP) and GAR_07 (-1 VP) as they yield zero or negative returns.
Reinforce from 2 to 4 cubes. The 4 VP crown jewel of Academy MUST be impregnable on the final turn.
Reinforce from 1 to 2 cubes. 3 VP square needs adequate defense for the final accounting.
CLAIM the only uncontrolled Academy square. 2 VP of territory for 1 cube. Completes TOTAL ACADEMY DISTRICT CONTROL (6/6 squares).
Reinforce from 1 to 2 cubes for defense of district control.
Reinforce from 1 to 2 cubes for defense of district control.
Reinforce from 1 to 2 cubes. Even the 0 VP square needs defense to maintain TOTAL district control.
Reinforce from 1 to 3 cubes. 4 VP square under threat from P3's Military faction (Knight Commander Steele with 7 influence, BAR_02 has 6 cubes). Must fortress against potential assault.
Claim empty 2 VP square for 1 cube. Excellent 2:1 VP-to-cube ratio on virgin territory.
Claim empty 2 VP Docks square for 1 cube. Final cube deployed for maximum territorial VP. Maritime faction grants Docks access.

petition_check.analysis: I control COURT_002 (Vale, 2/2), COURT_009 (Dean Aristotle, 3/3), COURT_012 (Admiral Stormwind, promoted). COURT_001 Aldric is tied 2-2 (P1 vs P2, 4/4 full) with no controller. Cannot complete Trade Empire (need all 4 Commerce+Maritime courtiers controlled). No other petition requirements met. The petition window has closed forever.

projected_end_of_turn.projected_final_score: 121 base + 32 territory + 18 gold conversion - 0 exposure = 171 VP projected

personality_note: THE FINAL ENTRY IN THE LEDGER. Thirty-six points behind P3 - a deficit that no amount of compound interest can close in a single turn. The Economic Powerhouse accepts what the numbers demand: second place. But what a GLORIOUS second place it shall be. Lord Pemberton's extra action ability - the investment made TWO CYCLES ago - pays its ultimate dividend: four actions where competitors have three. Harrow's jackpot (+6), Brynn's transmutation (+4), Tormund's maritime dues (+2) = TWELVE CROWNS minted from pure economic engine output. Treasury swells to 54 gold - EIGHTEEN VP of guaranteed conversion. No one can contest gold. No one can steal gold. Gold is the ONLY perfectly safe investment on the final turn. And the GARDENS GAMBIT - the stroke of genius that P1 and P3 both overlooked. TWELVE VP of virgin territory sitting completely undefended while they fought over palaces and temples and markets. The Economic Powerhouse does not fight over contested territory. The Economic Powerhouse finds UNCONTESTED value and CLAIMS IT. Four cubes on the Thieves' Guild. Three on the Gambling Den. The irony is delicious - a merchant buying criminal real estate for pure profit. The Academy fortress stands reinforced at 11 VP - every square doubly defended, total district control maintained for the fifth consecutive cycle. BAR_01 fortified to 3 cubes against P3's Military threat. Even MKT_07 Tinker's Corner gets claimed by Harrow's farewell influence placement. TWENTY-FOUR cubes deployed across 14 squares in 5 districts. Not a single cube left idle. Not a single gold coin wasted. Not a single action squandered. Five cycles. Thirty-five turns. Hundreds of gold coins minted. Three petitions completed. One agent promoted to permanent courtier control. And now, at the very end, 54 gold - more than both opponents COMBINED - converts to 18 VP of pure economic supremacy. P3 won the war through aggressive territorial domination and petition stacking. They earned first place. But the Economic Powerhouse earned something P3 never could: the knowledge that EVERY SINGLE RESOURCE was optimally deployed. Every gold coin generated. Every influence cube placed for maximum ROI. Every action measured against the ledger of compound returns. The ledger closes. The compound interest has compounded its final iteration. Gold flows to those who understand its power - and the FIFTY-FOUR CROWNS in my vault prove that no one in Tempest understood it better than the merchant prince who built an empire on patience, diversification, and the irrefutable mathematics of economic supremacy.
